valsi.definition: time tense relation/direction: is [selbri]; during/simultaneous with [sumti]; present tense.
sumti question asking for a time/date/event; simultaneous with what?.
modal aspect: actuality/ongoing event.
$cl_1$ is unaided by/without apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment $ca_1=cl_2$ for function $ca_2$ controlled/triggered by $ca_3$ (agent).
evidential: I define.
$b_1=c_2$ is a wind from direction $b_2$ with speed $b_3$, shoving/pushing $c_2$ at locus $c_3$.
$car_1=cat_2$ is a pushcart/wheelbarrow for carrying $car_2$.
$g_1=c_1$ pushes $m_1=c_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$.
$s_1$ is a valve/piston of material $s_2$, shoving/pushing $c_2$ at locus $c_3$.
catni modal, 1st place by authority of ...
$cp_1=ca_2$ demands $cp_2=ca_2$ from $cp_3$.
$cu_1=ca_1$ (agent) permits/lets/allows $cu_2$ (event) under conditions $cu_3$, derived from authority on basis $ca_3$.
$j_1$ is a charge of service $j_2$ to consumer $j_3=c_2$ set and levied by authority $j_4=c_1$.
$z_2$ is official, approved by authority $z_1=c_1$ over sphere/people $c_2$.

$x_1=v_1$ is an authoritative document of $x_2=v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $x_3=v_3$ (object/event) preserved in medium $x_4=v_4$, by authority $x_5=c_1$ over matter/sphere/persons $x_6=c_2$ derived on basis $x_7=c_3$.
interval event contour: during ...; continuative |-----|.
location tense relation/direction; forwards/to the front of ...
time tense: has been, is now in the aftermath of; (tense/modal).
$d_1=c_1$ is today; $d_1=c_1$ is the day occuring at the same time as $c_2$, day standard $d_3$.
$m_1=c_1$ is the current month by month standard $m_3$, simultaneous with $c_2$ in time.
$x_{1}$ is current at/in the present of/during/concurrent/simultaneous with $x_{2}$ in time.
valsi.notes: (default $x_2$ is the present resulting in:) $x_1$ is now; time relationship only, 'aorist' claiming simultaneity does not mean one event does not extend into the past or future of the other. See also {zvati}, {balvi}, {purci}, cmavo list {ca}, cmavo list {ca'a}.

valsi.definition: $n_1$ is the current year by standard $n_3$, simultaneous with $c_2$ in time.
$x_{1}$ is apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment for function $x_{2}$ controlled/[triggered] by $x_{3}$ (agent).
valsi.notes: Form determined by/from function; does not imply automated/automatic action - requires an external agent/trigger (a minji may be a zmiku cabra if it requires an external agent to trigger or control the functions that it performs automatically). (cf. {tutci}, {minji}, {finti}; {girzu}, {ganzu} for organizational apparatus, pilno)

valsi.definition: $ce_1$ is the modern era.
$c_1=f_1$ is live (experienced as it happens) to experiencer $c_2$.
$k_1=c_1$ ranges through time/has duration $k_2=c_2$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is the complete duration as the amount of time or an interval specification and is non-aorist. Cf. {temci}.

valsi.definition: time tense: present actuality; modal aspect.
time tense: is now/simultaneously, is now in the middle of; (tense/modal).
$k_1=t_1$ is a tradition/practice/custom of traditional culture $t_2=k_2$ under conditions $t_3$
valsi.notes: This is similar to {ritli}, but the emphasis is not necessarily on particular rituals, but customs (ex. wearing of a particular type of clothing or hairstyle) associated with a group.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ hours in duration (default is 1 hour) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ hours in angular measure of right ascension RA (default is 1).
valsi.notes: Cf. {cacra}, {radno}, {julra'o}, {sostartai}. {pi'e} used in x2 indicates a base of 60.

valsi.definition: $j_1=t_1$ is a convention prescribing $j_2$ (event/state) within community $j_3=t_2$.
$c_1=t_2$ customarily expresses $c_2$ to $c_3$ via medium $c_4$ under conditions $t_3$.
$cat_1=can_1$ is a lurker/inactively watches $cat_2$
$k_1=c_1$ (agent) idly plays with plaything/toy $k_2$.
$s_1=c_1$ (agent) ceases and rests from activity/process/state $s_2$ (not necessarily completing it).
$x_{1}$ walks/strides/paces on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$.
$l_1$ is liquid at room temperature/at standard temperature and pressure, and consists of composition/material $l_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event) often/frequently/commonly/customarily occurs/recurs by standard $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: See also {rirci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {rapli}, {krefu}, {lakne}, cmavo list piso'iroi and similar {compounds}.

valsi.definition: $r_1$ is a frequently-asked question about subject $r_2$
$di_1$ is a barn for storing/sheltering grains/livestock/tools/machinery $da_1$.
$x_1$ is a wound on body $x_2$ at locus $x_3$ caused by $x_4$
valsi.notes: Unlike velxai, it's specific to physical injuries pertaining to the surface of an organic body such as skin. Open wounds include ka'arcagna for "incision / incised wound", fercagna for "laceration", gukcagna for "abrasion", tuncagna for "puncture wound", grecagna for "penetration wound", batcagna for "bite wound", dancagna for "gunshot wound", jelcagna for "burn", da'ercagna for "bedsore", furcagna for "necrosis"; closed wounds include daxcagna for "contusion/bruise", camdaxcagna for "hematoma", ra'ircagna for "chronic wound".

valsi.definition: $g_1$ is a/the agricultural industry/sector producing $g_2=c_4$ from farms $c_1$ located in $c_2$ farmed by $c_3$.
$p_1$ is a farmer associated with farm $c_1$ producing $c_4$.
$z_1$ is a farmer's market selling $z_2$, operated by farmers $z_3=c_3$.
attitudinal: strong intensity attitude modifier.
$b_1=c_1$ is huge/enormous/colossal in property $b_2=c_2$ to observer $b_3=c_3$.
$cat_1$ stares at $cat_2$ as received by observer $car_3$.
$d_1$ craves/intensely wishes $d_2$ (event/state) for purpose $d_3$.
$n_1$ desperately needs/is desperate for $n_2$ for purpose/action/stage of process $n_3$.
$s_1=c_1$ is roaring/blinding to $s_2$ via sensory channel $s_2=c_3$.
time tense: during and after; (tense/modal).
$g_1$ is a/the wholesale/retail industry sector in which $c_1$ trades/barters $c_2 $ for $c_3$ by process $g_3$.
$s_1$ (set) mutually exchange/trade/barter commodity $c_2$ for $c_3$ with $c_4$.
$x_1$ is a beetle of species $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Not to be confused with {ckacinki}; Cf. {kokcinela}, {kurkuli}, {gusycinki}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a mollusk/clam/mussel/snail of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is malacology based on methodology $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of chocolate/cocoa.
$p_1=j_3=c_3$ is mother of pearl from source $p_2=c_2$.
$j_1$ is a crustacean of species/class $j_2$.
$k_1=c_2$ is a tank/armored combat vehicle for carrying $k_2$, propelled by $k_3$, with armor-plating $c_1$.
$x_1$ is a turtle of species $x_2$.
$c_1=t_1$ is space-time occupied by $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a shell/husk [hard, protective covering] around $x_{2}$ composed of $x_{3}$.
$cm_1$ is a geometry describing $cm_2=ca_1=t_1$ geometric object.
$cp_1=ca_1$ demands $cp_2$ from $cp_3$.
$g_1=c_1$ is vast/very wide in (2nd most significant) dimension $g_2=c_2$ with observer $g_3=c_3$.
$g_1$ is intensely happy about $g_2$.
Robin Lee Powell.
valsi.notes: Name Lojbanized according to its meaning.

valsi.definition: $k_1=c_1$ screams/howls sound $k_2$.
$x_1$ is a champagne made from grapes $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {vanju}, {fomvanju}, {risyvanju}, {xalka}, {koinka}. For sparkling wines without an AOC designation, use {fomvanju}.

valsi.definition: $ci_1$ is a fan of/intensely interested in $ci_2$ as received/measured by observer $ca_3$.
$g_1$ is a fanclub for $g_2=ci_2$.
$ci_1=m_2$ is toucan/toucanet of species/type $ci_1$ with bill $m_1=s_1$ of typically intense color or colors $s_2=ca_1$
$t_1$ feels horror/is intensely frightened of $t_2$ (event/tu'a object).
$c_1$ effortfully tries to do $t_2$ by method $t_3$, as perceived by $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ vanishes/disappears from location $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ ceases to be observed at $x_{2}$ using senses/sensor $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also leaves, goes away (one sense). See also {cliva}, {ganse}, {zgana}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is silicon.
$x_{1}$ is idle/at rest/inactive.
valsi.notes: "in motion", not implying a change in location, is negation of this. See also {surla}.

valsi.definition: Hong Kong.
$x_{1}$ is a farm/ranch at $x_{2}$, farmed by $x_{3}$, raising/producing $x_{4}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is agrarian.
valsi.notes: Also grange; farming is any organized agrarian activity, not limited to plant crops. See also {purdi}, {nurma}, {ferti}, {foldi}, {xarju}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ exchanges/trades/barters commodity $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$, $x_{4}$ is a trader/merchant/businessman.
valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_4$ is/are commercial (better expressed as ka canja, {kamcanja}). $x_2$/$x_3$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posycanja} for unambiguous semantics); (cf. {dunda}, {friti}, {vecnu}, {zarci}, {jdini}, {pleji}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {banxa}, {cirko}, {dunda}, {janta}, {kargu}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {zivle})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a window/portal/opening [portal] in wall/building/structure $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is space/volume/region/room [at-least-3-dimensional area] occupied by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sand/grit from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the gut(s)/entrails/intestines/viscera/innards/digestive system [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$g_1$ disembowels $c_2=b_2$.
Shanghai.
$l_1$ is an adventurer traveling via route $l_2$ using means/vehicle $x_3$.
$x_1$ threatens $x_2$ with $x_3$ (danger, peril).
$b_1$ snarls/growls/roars the threat (utterance) of idea/action $s_2$ at audience $s_3$.
$s_1$ (agent) threatens/menaces idea/action $s_2$ to audience $s_3$.
time tense: is going to, is now just about to, is now anticipating; (tense/modal).
$j_1$ is careful of $j_2=c_1$, which is dangerous to $c_2$ under conditions $c_3$
$b_1=c_1$ is a tornado/waterspout moving from direction $b_2$ at speed $b_3$ rotating around centre /eye $c_2$ with rotational direction $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a cart/carriage/wagon [wheeled vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$l_1$ reels in $l_2=c_1$ by handle/at locus $l_3$ by rotating it around axis $c_2$.
$cr_1=ca_1$ turns to face $cr_2$.
$cu_1$ is a roller skate/ice skate for feet $cu_2$, of material $cu_3$, for carrying $x_4=ca_2$.
$k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) cartloads/wagonloads in quantity.
$x_1$ turns $x_2$ around axis $x_3$ in direction $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a whirligig beetle of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is intense/bright/saturated/brilliant in property (ka) $x_{2}$ as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also lustrous, gleaming, sparkling, shining (all probably better metaphorically combined with gusni: gusycai or camgu'i); in colors, refers principally to increased saturation (with opposite kandi). See also {denmi}, {gusni}, {kandi}, {ruble}, {skari}, {tilju}, {tsali}, {mutce}, {blabi}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ turns/rotates/revolves around axis $x_{2}$ in direction $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a helicopter for carrying $x_2$, propelled by $x_3$.
Rot-13.
$x_{1}$ is a chart/diagram/map of/about $x_{2}$ showing formation/data-points $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ rains/showers/[precipitates] to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is precipitation [not limited to 'rain'].
$x_{1}$(s) (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [agent] shoves/pushes $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Move by pushing/shoving (= {ca'ermuvgau}). (cf. danre for non-agentive force, lacpu)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ looks at/examines/views/inspects/regards/watches/gazes at $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also look through (= {grecta}, {ravycta}, {bacycta}); note that English "look" often means a more generic "observe". See also {jvinu}, {minra}, {simlu}, {viska}, {lanli}, {zgana}, {setca}, {viska}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ has authority/is an official in/on/over matter/sphere/persons $x_{2}$ derived on basis $x_{3}$.
$j_1$ is the bishop/archbishop of $j_2$ of religion $l_1$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) kills/slaughters/murders $x_{2}$ by action/method $x_{3}$.
$m_1$ orders $m_2$ to have $c_2$ excecuted by action/method $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a hitman.
claxu modal, 1st place lacked by ...
$cl_1=ci_1$ misses $cl_2=ci_3$.
$g_1$ (person/agent) deprives $c_1$ of $c_2$.
$l_1$ (agent) showers $l_2$.
$f_1=c_1$, consisting of $f_2$, pours into $f_3=c_2$ from $f_4=c_3$.
$k_1$ is a raincoat of material $k_2$, protecting from rain $c_1$.
$l_1=s_1$ (agent) showers itself of soil/contaminant $l_3$ with cleaning material(s) $l_4$.
$x_1$ is a game of chess between $x_2$ (white) and $x_3$ (black).
$x_{1}$ is shallow in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$f_1$ is actual (existing in act or reality, not just potentially).
$f_1$ is rotten/decayed/fermented with decay/fermentation agent $f_2$.
non-logical connective: set link, unordered; "and also", but forming a set.
2-word letteral/shift: the word following indicates a new font (e.g. italics, manuscript).
lambda variable prenex; marks the end of introduction of lambda-scope variables.
valsi.notes: Cf. {zo'u}. In effect this word is used as a shortcut around verbose repeated assignment in a {ka} prenex: lo ka ce'u goi ko'a ce'u goi ko'e ... zo'u ... is the same as lo ka ko'a ko'a ko'e ... ce'ai ... In either form this style can be used to avoid subscripting and to disambiguate nested {ka}, {ni}, etc.

valsi.definition: links terms into an afterthought termset.
digit/number: % percentage symbol, hundredths.
non-logical connective: ordered sequence link; "and then", forming a sequence.
pseudo-quantifier binding a variable within an abstraction that represents an open place.
$x_{1}$ launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$ [propellant/propulsion].
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is a gun/launcher/cannon; $x_1$ hurls/throws/casts (more general than renro in that propulsion need not be internal to $x_1$). See also {renro}, {danti}, {jakne}, {jbama}, {spoja}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a community/colony of organisms $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an era/epoch/age characterized by $x_{2}$ (event/property/interval/idea).
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; $x_2$ may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); See also {ranji}, {temci}, {citsi}.

valsi.definition: $m_1=c_1$ is contemporary with/in the same epoch/era as $m_2$ by standard $m_3$ ($m_1=c_1$ and $m_2$ interchangeable).
selbri variable assignment; assigns broda series pro-bridi to a selbri.
$k_1$ believes (without evidence/proof) that the god/deity $c_1$ exists.
$x_{1}$ is a/the habitation/dwelling/house of god $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ is an agnostic.
$z_1$ is the Heaven of religious community $c_2$.
$x_1$ is a polo shirt of material $x_2$.
valsi.notes: A T-shaped shirt with a collar, typically a two- or three-button placket, and an optional pocket. Cf. {creka}.

valsi.definition: $g_1=c_2$ is an arrow made of $g_2$ fired/launched by $c_1$.

$g_1$ (person/mass) attacks with a projectile weapon/shoots victim $g_2$ with goal/objective $g_3$ using launcher/gun $c_1$ which launches/fires/shoots projectile/missle $c_2$ propelled by propellant/propulsion $c_3$.
$x_1$ is Sagittarius [astronomical constellation/astrological sign].
valsi.notes: From shooter (={celgunta}). The Babylonians identified Sagittarius as the god Pabilsaƒù, a strange centaur-like creature firing an arrow from a bow.The sumerian name may be translated as the 'Forefather' or 'Chief Ancestor' (=barda dzena?). In Greek mythology, Sagittarius is identified as a centaur: half human, half horse.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is December of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$xa_1=c_1$ is a gun/cannon/firearm for use against $xa_2$ by $xa_3$, launching projectile $c_2$ propelled by $c_3$.
valsi.notes: jvajvo; Gismu deep structure is "cecla gi'e xarci".

valsi.definition: $l_1=c_1$ is a tribe with members including $l_1$ according standard $l_3$.
$s1$ pertains to community $s2=c2$
valsi.notes: Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for communities: From gismu {cecmu} and {srana}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ varies/changes in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) in amount/degree $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Non-resultative, not-necessarily causal change. (cf. cenba which is non-resultative, galfi which is resultative and causal, stika which is non-resultative and causal; stodi, zasni, binxo)

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is $x_2$ percent of $x_3$ in dimension/aspect $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a hundredth [1/100; $1*10^{-2}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$m_1=c_1$ is $m_2=c_2$ centimeter(s) / hundredth(s) of a meter [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $m_3=c_3$ by standard $x_4=m_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an heir to/is to inherit $x_{2}$ (object/quality) from $x_{3}$ according to rule $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in $x_2$) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= {posycerda}, posyselcerda for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {jgina}.

valsi.definition: $m_1=c_1$ is the dawn of day $m_2=c_2$ at location $m_3=c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a morning [dawn until after typical start-of-work for locale] of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: This morning (= {cabdeicerni}); tomorrow morning (= {bavlamcerni}); yesterday morning (= {prulamcerni}, {prulamdeicerni}) See also {vanci}, {murse}, {tcika}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ (mass) is a breakfast composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is an expert/pro/has prowess in/is skilled at $x_{2}$ (event/activity) by standard $x_{3}$.
morning sickness
$r_1$ blesses/sanctifies $c_1$ in the name of person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$ under conditions $r_3$.
$s_1$ worships $s_2=c_1$, which is holy/sacred to $c_2=r_3$, with ritual $r_1$ having form/rules $r_4$.
$cu_1=ce_1$ is a holy book containing work $cu_2$ by (presumed) author $cu_3$ for audience $cu_4=ce_2$ preserved in medium $cu_5$.
$s_1=c_1$ is a holy site to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$.
God.
$x_{1}$ is a/the god/deity of people(s)/religion $x_{2}$ with dominion over $x_{3}$ [sphere]; $x_{1}$ is divine.
valsi.notes: Also divinity; $x_2$ religion refers to the religious community as a mass. See also {censa}, {krici}, {lijda}, {malsi}.

valsi.definition: $b_1$ is entirely in the future of $b_2$; $b_1$ begins after $b_2$.
$g_1$ notices $g_2$ by means $g_3$ under condition $g_4=c_1$.
$x_1=g_1$ (person/agent) initiates/begins/starts/causes the beginning of $x_2=c_1$ (state/event/process).
$p_1$ is preliminary to $c_1=p_2$'s beginning.
$x_{1}$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur; (intransitive verb).
$r_1$ is/are the ritual/proceedings for starting/commencing $c_1$[event/state/process] by community $r_2$ with rules $c_4$.
$s_1$ realizes $s_2$ under condition $c_1$.
$x_1$ sits down on $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {co'a}, {cfari}, {zutse}, {nitytse}, {tsebi'o}. Simple {zutse} refers to the act of sitting, whereas cfatse means the act of beginning to sit.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a work of fiction about plot/theme/subject $x_{2}$/under convention $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also story, lie, untrue. See also {cukta}, {lisri}, {prosa}, {fatci}, {jitfa}, {jetnu}, {xanri}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (property - ka) is a flaw/fault/defect in $x_{2}$ causing $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wedge [shape/form/tool] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) confuses/baffles $x_{2}$ [observer] due to [confusing] property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$s_1$ diagnoses/proof-reads/searches/tests/debugs for flaw/property $c_1=s_2$ in $c_2=s_3$ causing $c_3$
digit/number: 3 (digit) [three].
$j_1$ is a writing desk of material $j_2$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $j_3$, used by writer $c_1$.
$f_1=c_1$ writes/authors $f_2=c_2$ for purpose $f_3$ from existing elements/ideas $f_4$.
$s_1=c_2$ is a secretary to $s_2$.
$cu_1=ci_1$ expresses in writing $cu_2=ci_2$ for audience $cu_3$ using display/storage medium $ci_3$ with writing implement $ci_4$.
ciste modal, 1st place used in scalar negation in system/context ...
$k_1$ plays game $k_2=c_1$ governed by rules $c_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual) $c_3$.
$ke_1=kl_1$ has score $kl_2$ in game $ke_2=c_1$ governed by rules $c_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual) $c_3$.
valsi.notes: klani3 (the scale of the score) is implicit in the rules of the game.

valsi.definition: digit/number: infinity; followed by digits =RefEntity "gt" aleph cardinality.
tense interval modifier: occurs infinite times, eternally; objective tense; defaults as time.
$c_1=z_1$ is more interesting than $z_2$ to $c_2$ in amount $z_4$.
cinmo modal, 1st place emotionally felt by ...
ckilu modal, 1st place on the scale ...
$x_1$ is a Wednesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$c_1$ is trigonometry of triangle $j_1$.
$t_1$ is a triangle.
$d_1$ is a triangle (musical instrument).
$g_1$ is $g_2$ yard/yards (length unit).
$x_1$ is myrrh from tree species $x_2$.

See also {cipra}, {danfu}, {jalge}, {jinvi}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {nabmi}, {preti}, {rinka}, {sidbo}, {zukte}, {tavla}.

$x_1$ is a Mandarin orange/tangerine/Citrus reticulata of species/variety/cultivar $x_2$
$n_1$ is a roll/bun/biscuit/bun made from grains $n_2$.
$p_1$ is an asteroid revolving around $p_2$ with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
$t_1=c_1$ is the smallest among set/range $t_4$ in property/dimension $c_2 $(ka).
$r_1$ is a creek/stream in land mass $r_2$, draining watershed $r_3$ into $r_4$/terminating at $r_4$.
$c_1=r_1$ is a small rock of type $r_2$ from location $r_3$, small by standard $c_3$. $c_1$ is gravel.
$c_1=s_1$ is a/the sprout/shoot of plant/species $s_2$ by standard/norm $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a village in administrative area $x_3$ serving hinterland $x_4$ small by standard $x_5$.
$x1=c1=m1$ is tiny in property\dimension $x2=c2$ by standard $x3=c3$
$cman_1=cmal_1$ is a hillock/mound/rise/knoll in terrain $cman_2$, small by standard $cmal_3$.
$r_1=cmal_1$ is a rivulet on surface/terrain $r_2$ draining $r_3$ terminating at $r_4$ small by standard $cmal_3$.
$m_1=c_1$ is tiny/miniscule/diminutive in property/dimension(s) $c_2$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.
$t_1$ is a tone low in pitch/frequency from source $t_3$.
$t_1$ is a brush/bushy vegetation of species/type $t_2$.
$x1=c1=t1$ is a patch of land at $x2=t2$
$x_{1}$ is a structure word of grammatical class $x_{2}$, with meaning/function $x_{3}$ in usage (language) $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_4$ may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; $x_3$ and $x_4$ may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) ma'oste); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = ma'orpoi, ma'orselcmi, ma'orselste). See also {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}.

valsi.definition: $xi_1=c_1$ is a pony of species/breed $xi_2$.
$z_1$ is a hut of/for $z_1$, small as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.
$z_1=c_1$ shrinks/decreases in property $c_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$g_1$ causes $z_1=c_1$ to decrease in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$b_1$ is a pseudonym/pronoun, replacing real name $b_2=c_1$ of $x_3=c_2$ in circumstance $x_4=b_3$.
Nameless.
$x_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of $x_{2}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $x_{3}$ (person).
valsi.notes: Also: $x_2$ is called $x_1$ by $x_3$ (= selcme for reordered places). See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ identifies $s_2=c_2$ by name $c_1$ used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).
$l_1$ is an onomasticon of names $l_2=c_1$ in order $l_3$ in medium $l_4$.
$t_1$ is a name tag/nameplate of $t_2=c_2$ showing text $c_1$.
$g_1=v_3$ registers $c_2$ with user-name $c_1$ on system/application $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
valsi.notes: In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. Examples: {lojban}, {jegvon}, {camgusmis}.

valsi.definition: $b_1=c_1$ becomes a member of group $b_2=c_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$cm_1=cu_1$ votes for $cu_2$ among choices $cu_3$ in voting group $cm_2$.
valsi.notes: Applies to any election, not just public ones. Cf. {turni}.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is suffrage entitled to $k_2=cu_1$ by standard $k_3$.
valsi.notes: It is a civil right, {selcemkrali}. Cf. {cmicu'a}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ puts together $c_1$ into group $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ laughs (emotional expression).
$x_{1}$ is a member/element of set $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ belongs to group $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is amid/among/amongst group $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ may be a complete or incomplete list of members; $x_2$ is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership. See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

valsi.definition: $s_1=c_1$ is logged into system/application $s_2=c_2$.
$g_1=v_3$ registers $c_1$ as a member of $c_2$, registration preserved in medium $x_3=v_4$.
$z_1=c_1$ participates in employing means/taking action $z_2$ for purpose/goal $z_3$.
$x_{1}$ utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] $x_{2}$ expressing $x_{3}$ (property).
valsi.notes: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an element of kind $x_2$ with purity $x_3$.
$d_1=c_1$ is a chisel for carving $d_2=c_2$ with blade of material $d_3$.
$x_{1}$ [value] is a norm/average in property/amount $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) among $x_{3}$(s) (set) by standard $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also mean, normal, usual; ($x_3$ specifies the complete set). See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a/the neck [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].
$x_{1}$ (agent) rewards $x_{2}$ [recipient] for atypical $x_{3}$ (event/property) with reward/desserts $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, posyvelne'u for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the derivative of $x_2$ with respect to $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni).
$x_1$ feels $x_2$ (ka) about $x_3$ feeling $x_4$ (ka) about $x_5$
$co_1=ci_1$ hurts emotionally due to $ci_3$.
$d_1=c_1$ is far/distant from $d_2$ in feeling $d_3=c_2$.
$j_1=c_1$ shows emotion $j_2=c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ to audience $j_3$.
$j_1=c_3$ excites $j_2=c_1$.
$x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$ in feeling $x_3$.
$v_1$ is an attitudinal meaning $v_2=c_1$ in language $v_3$.
$x_{1}$ is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a novelty.
$r_1$ is the sense/feeling in $c_1$ of emotion $c_2$ about $c_3$.
$x_1=r_1$ (event) moves/touches $x_2=c_1$ (person), causing emotion $x_3=c_2$ about object of emotion $x_4=c_3$ with causation conditions $x_5=r_3$; $x_1=r_1$ (event) is moving/touching.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].
$s_1$ is the heart (emotional self) of $s_2=c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from $x_{2}$ in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$t_1=c_2$ is the mood experienced by $t_2=c_1$ about $c_3$.
$v_1$ sighs due to emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ breathing/respiring $v_2$.
$xr_1$ offends $xr_2=c_1$ affecting emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ resulting in $xr_4$ (state).
tanru inversion operator; "... of type ..."; allows modifier trailing sumti without sumti links.
interval event contour: at the starting point of ...; initiative RefEntity "gt"|RefEntity "lt" |.
$x_1=cf_1$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur from its natural start; (intransitive verb).
valsi.notes: See {co'a} {cfari}. $x_1$ starts from the very beginning. Also in the sense of 'starting anew' or 'starting from scratch'.

valsi.definition: $b_1$ starts to become $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$c_1$ (agent) starts to express/say $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$.
elliptical/unspecified bridi relationship.
interval event contour: at the instantaneous point of ...; achievative; point event RefEntity "gt"|RefEntity "lt".
vocative: partings/good-bye.
Combination of {coi} and {co'o}, indicating either greetings or partings according to context.
valsi.notes: The scalar negated forms of this COI are apparently identical to its positive form. cf. {coi}, {co'o}, {rinsa}, {tolrinsa}.

valsi.definition: interval event contour: at the ending point of ... even if not done; cessative | RefEntity "gt"RefEntity "lt" |.
$d_1$ is relieved from stress/discomfort $d_2$
vocative: greetings/hello.
vocative: greetings in passing.
$x_{1}$ soaks up/absorbs/sucks up $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ into $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is an absorbant.
$x_{1}$ is deep in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ gets/procures/acquires/obtains/accepts $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$ [previous possessor not implied].
valsi.notes: Also fetch; accept a gift (= {seldu'acpa}). See also {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is upon/atop/resting on/lying on [the upper surface of] $x_{2}$ in frame of reference/gravity $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_1$ may be object or event); See also se {vasru}, {jbini}, {zvati}, {nenri}, {vreta}, {ckana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {zutse}, {punji} for lay upon, {sarji}, {zbepi}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ causes $c_1$ to [rest on]/[be on top of]/[lie on] $c_2$ in frame of reference $c_3$.
$g_1=c_1$ rides/mounts/has sexual intercourse on top of $g_2=c_2$, in frame of reference/gravity $c_3$.
$f_1=c_1$ refuses $f_2=c_2$ from $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on surface $x_{2}$ in direction $x_{3}$ using $x_{4}$ [limbs/tools].
$z_1=c_1$ approves the receipt of $c_2$ from $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ requests/asks/petitions/solicits for $x_{2}$ of/from $x_{3}$ in manner/form $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also demand (= {mi'ecpe}); $x_4$ is a means of expression See also ve {cusku}.: a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor). (cf. pikci, te preti, te frati, se spuda, danfu)

valsi.definition: $cu_1=cp_1$ pleas/[expresses request] $cu_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to $cu_3=cp_3$ via expressive medium $cu_4$.
$x_1$ complies with/accedes to request $x_2$ made by $x_3$.
$x_1$ complies with request $x_2$ from $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a gryphon/griffin/griffon.
$x_{1}$ is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ is a sense-irritating plant/thistle of species $x_2$.
$t_1=c_1$ is a hot/pungent spice causing flavor/effect $t_2$ (event/property).
$x_1$ is a bird of species Pica Pica / Eurasian(Common) Magpie
$z_1$ is a nest of bird $z_2$=$c_1$ of genus/species/etc. $c_2$.
$l_1=m_1$ is a tractor pulling $l_2$.
$g_1=l_1$ pulls $m_1=l_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$ at handle/locus $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] $x_{2}$ via station/frequency $x_{3}$ to [radio] receiver $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ is a broadcaster. See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a radio transceiver transmitting/receiving $c_2$ on frequency $c_3$ to/from transceiver $c_4$.
valsi.notes: The $x_3$ place may specify more than one frequency, for instance in cases where different frequencies are used for transmission and receipt. Cf. {veltivni}.

valsi.definition: $k_1=c_1$ advances to $k_2$ from $k_3=c_2$ via $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$k_1$ is an anteroom of/in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$l_1$ is an initial letter in alphabet/character-set $l_2$ representing $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

valsi.definition: $v_1=c_1$ is a front door/gateway/access between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of structure $v_4$.
$p_1$ is the front-cover picture/image/illustration showing $p_2$ made by artist $p_3$.
$c_1=b_1$ becomes expert at $c_2=b_2$ under conditions $b_3$ by standard $c_3$.
valsi.notes: Coined because {cilre} makes it hard to talk about just learning about a subject. Cf. {ckule}, {saske}, {ctuca}.

valsi.definition: $j_1=c_2$ is a profession (job) of person $j_2=c_1$.
valsi.notes: Especially a job requiring a high level of skill or training. Cf. {jibri}, {gunka}, {certu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance $x_2$
valsi.notes: This is a zi'evla made from crezenzu'e

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects $x_{2}$ from source/area $x_{3}$.
$j_1=c_1$ skillfully handles $j_2=c_2$ in event $j_3$.
$c_1=xa_1$ is a geek/nerd of field $c_2=xa_2$ (event/activity) by standard $c_3$.
$x_1$ practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a bear/ursoid of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is bearberry of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman. (cf. {ranmi}, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, {lijda})

valsi.definition: $s_1$ (mass of facts) is the science of fairies/elves/pixies [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $c_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$x_1=g_1$ causes $x_2=c_1$ to lose property $x_3=c_2$
valsi.notes: The third place of cirko is the event itself. cf. {cirko} and {gasnu}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is green/verdant [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a bridge/span over/across $x_{2}$ between $x_{3}$ and $x_{4}$ [unordered, typically destination first].
$x_{1}$ is summer/summertime [hot season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$g_1$ practices sadomasochism with $g_2=c_1$ with pain at locus $c_2$.
$r_1$ (event/state) hurts/causes pain for $x_2=c_1$ at locus $x_3=c_2$.
$t_1$ is hot spice.
$v_1$ is a hot/spicy taste/flavor of/emitted by $v_2$.
$x_1=j_1=c_1$ is a rule permitting/allowing $x_2=j_2=c_2$ (event/state) within system/community $x_3=j_3$ under conditions $x_4=c_3$
valsi.notes: The use of $c_1$ there is perhaps a bit iffy; the point here is that it's non-agentive.

valsi.definition: $t_1$ is a situation / condition / state / position that allows / is sufficient for event $c_2=t_2$ under conditions $c_3$.
valsi.notes: As the whole point of this word is to ignore the agentive nature of c1, c1 has been dropped. Cf. {curmi}, {tcini}, {rau}, {banzu}.

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a permit allowing $c_2$ (event) under conditions $c_3$, preserved in medium $v_4$.
$k_1=c_1$ is the audit committee of $k_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in $x_{2}$ caused by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is labial.
$x_1$ is a nightjar/goatsucker/whippoorwill of genus/species $x_2$.
$c_1$ is an owl of species $c_2$.
$d_1$ is dew.
$x_{1}$ is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event $x_{2}$ levied against $x_{3}$ by authority/collector $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is dark of night of day $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$m_1$ is the midnight of $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$x_1$ is a nightingale of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ is a supper composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$cin_1$ is a/are chopstick(s) for eating $cit_2$.
$cp_1$ orders food $ci_2$ for $cp_2$ from $cp_3$ in manner/form $cp_4$.
$d_1$ is a table knife for cutting food $d_2=c_2$, with blade of material $d_3$.
$g_1$ feeds $c_1$ with food $c_2$.
$x1=k1$ is a bowl for food $x2=c2=k2$ made from material $x3=k3$
$k_1$ is a dining room in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an oil lamp using petroleum-based products, illuminating $x_2$ with light $x_1$.
$v_1$ is a fuel tank.
$x_{1}$ is a shadow/the shade of object $x_{2}$, made by light/energy source $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ sets up diet $p_2$ for $c_1$ consisting of food $c_2$.
$p_1$ is the digestion of food $p_2=c_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $c_1$.
$g_1$ digests food $p_2=c_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $c_1$.
$s_1$ celebrates $s_2$ with a banquet/feast.
$t_1$ is cutlery for eating $c_2$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ centuries in duration by standard $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ teaches audience $x_{2}$ ideas/methods/lore $x_{3}$ (du'u) about subject(s) $x_{4}$ by method $x_{5}$ (event).
valsi.notes: Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) $x_1$/$x_5$ is pedagogical. See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

valsi.definition: $ci_1$ is an education system interrelated by administrative policies $ci_2$ among institutions $ci_3=ct_1$ displaying quality $ci_4$.
$cu_1=ct_1$ is a textbook for teaching ideas/methods $ct_3$ (du'u), by author $cu_3$ for audience $cu_4=ct_2$ about subject(s) $ct_4$ by method $ct_5$, preserved in medium $cu_5$.
$x_1=g_1=c_2$ works on $x_2=g_2=c_5$ for teacher $x_3=c_1$ to learn facts $x_4=c_3$ about subject $x_5=c_4$
$n_1$ are instructions by $c_1$ teaching audience $c_2$ ideas/methods/lore $c_3$ (du'u) about subject(s) $c_4$ by method $c_5$ (event).
$n_1=c_5$ is a lecture / an event of verbal teaching by $t_1=c_1$ to audience $t_2 = c_2$ about subject $t_3 = c_4$ in language $t_4$ with facts taught $c_3$.
elidable marker: separates selbri from preceding sumti, allows preceding terminator elision.
unary mathematical operator: absolute value/norm |a|.
$cm_1=cu_1$ is a member of electorate $cm_2$, which votes/selects $cu_2$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $cu_3$.
valsi.notes: Gismu deep structure is "cuxna gi'e cmima"; Cf. {turni}, {cmicu'a}, {gubycu'a}, {jecta}.

valsi.definition: $k_1=c_1$ is a gaming die, with sides $k_3=c_3$, with side $c_2$ facing up and having dimensions $k_2$.
tense/modal question.
attitudinal: neutral scalar attitude modifier.
convert number to probability selbri; event $x_{1}$ has probability (n) of occurring under cond. $x_{2}$.
attitudinal: physical pain - comfort
cusku modal, 1st place (attribution/quotation) as said by source ...; used for quotation.
tagged sumti: can be used for embedded: it-1 said, "...", with editorial unquote and insert.
$p_1$ is a businessman/business woman involved in business $c_1$.
$m_1$ is a skate carrying $m_2$ on surface/medium $m_3$.
$t_1$ is the heel of shoe $t_2=c_1$ for covering/protecting feet $c_2$, and of material $c_3$.
$cl_1$ is barefoot/not wearing shoes.
$x_1=k_5$ is a roller skate to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$, transporting $x_5=k_1$.
$x_{1}$ is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; $x_{1}$ is a disk/circle/ring.
valsi.notes: Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'. See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

valsi.definition: $l_1$ goes/moves around/[in a circle] using means $l_3$.
$v_4=m_1=c_1$ is a computer disk/hard disk/floppy disk storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$v_4=m_1=c_1$ is a compact disc/optical disc storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$m_1=c_1$ (object) is completely round/full.
$j_1$ plays ultimate frisbee against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a book containing work $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ preserved in medium $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: [$x_1$ is a manifestation/container A physical object or its analogue. of a work/content, not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri})]; See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=c_1$ is a circle.
$v_4=g_2=c_1$ is a compact disc/optical disc storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$v_4$ is a gramophone record of $v_2$.
$x_1$ is a compass for drawing circles $x_2$.
$cp_1$ humbly asks for/implores $cp_2$ from $cp_3$ in manner/form $cp_4$.
$x_{1}$ is full/completely filled with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is possible under conditions $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ may/might occur; $x_{1}$ is a maybe.
$x_{1}$ is humble/modest about $x_{2}$ (abstraction); $x_{1}$ displays humility about $x_{2}$.
$n_1$ is a sales lead/opportunity for $v_1$ to sell $v_2$ to $v_3$ for amount $v_4$.
$x_1=p_2=c_1$ (subject/concept) is conceivable under conditions $c_2$.
$cf_1$ is science fiction about possible universe $cu_1=m_1$ by author $cf_3$.
$k_1$ gambles/plays the lottery $k_2$.
$f_1$ is shuffled/randomly distributed/cut among $f_2$ with shares/portions $f_3$.
$g_1$ shuffles/randomly distributes/cuts $x_2=f_1$ among $x_3=f_2$ with shares/portions $x_4=f_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$p_1$ bumps into/randomly encounters $p_2$ at/in location $p_3$.
$x_{1}$ is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions $x_{2}$, with probability distribution $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = cuncu'a, cunselcu'a, cunjdi, cunseljdi; based on "unpredictable"). See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) $x_{2}$ (ind./mass); $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s business.
valsi.notes: Also matter, concern; $x_2$ is engaged in $x_1$ (which is usually an abstraction) (= selcu'u for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

valsi.definition: $n_1=c_1$ (li) is a random number (noun), random under conditions $c_2$, with probability distribution $c_3$.
$l_1$ makes a round trip via route $l_2$ using means/vehicle $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ produces $x_{2}$ [product] by process $x_{3}$.
$p_1=c_1$ is a circularly ordered sequence by rule $p_2$ on unordered set $p_3$.
$c_1=f_1$ is an eel of species/breed $c_2=f_2$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) lets/permits/allows $x_{2}$ (event) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ grants privilege $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}). See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because many multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike. See also {since}, {silka}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_1=k_1$ is a spokesperson of/speaks on behalf of $x_2=k_2=c_1$, saying $x_3=c_2$ to $x_4=c_3$ via expressive medium $x_5=c_4$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) expresses/says $x_{2}$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_{3}$ via expressive medium $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also says. See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ edits/revises/adapts text $x_2$ by $x_3$ for audience $x_4$ in medium $x_5$.
$z_3$ is a condition for free expressive activity $z_2$ by agent $z_1=c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$b_1$ is a/the sternum/breastbone of body $b_3=c_2$.
valsi.notes: From greece sternum=chest. See also {cutne} and {srubo'u} (=rib).

valsi.definition: $g_1=c_1$ is the ribcage of $c_2$.
$t_1$ is the upper back [body-part] of $c_2$.
$s_1$=$j_1$=$c_1$ is bacteriology of bacteria $s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
valsi.notes: Bacteriology is the study of bacteria. Because of the similarity of thinking and working with microorganisms other than bacteria, there has been a tendency for the field of bacteriology to extend as microbiology (={jumske}). Bacteriology can be classified as a distinct science.

valsi.definition: $j_1$=$c_1$ is an (eu)bacterium of species/defining property $j_2$.
valsi.notes: Bacteria are a large domain of single-celled, prokaryote (={pruslemijyji'e}) microorganisms. See also {jurme}, {tceprujurme}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ chooses/selects $x_{2}$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $x_{3}$ (complete set).
$p_2=c_1$ filters $p_1=c_2$ to destination side $p_3$ from origin side $p_4$.
letteral for c.
